info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 12:14PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A moderate band of snow will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, southeastern Teton, southwestern Chouteau and northern Cascade Counties through 1245 PM MST... At 1211 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking moderate snow showers along a line extending from 9 miles south of The Knees to 9 miles northeast of Fort Shaw to 11 miles south of Augusta. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Brief period of moderate snow and winds up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Variable visibility down to a half mile or less and slippery roads could result in hazardous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Cascade, Black Eagle, Fort Shaw, Highwood, Fort Shaw, Power, Carter, Floweree, Portage, Malmstrom Afb, Bean Lake, Tracy, Vaughn, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Centerville, Sun River, Bowmans Corner, Tower Rock State Park and Ulm. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 235 and 305. Highway 200 between mile markers 88 and 139. Highway 287 between mile markers 2 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
